Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Isolated Hepatic Perfusion with Melphalan for Liver Metastases

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included WHO performance status 0-1 and specific blood parameters.

Intervention.evidence: Patients underwent a 60-min IHP with 200 mg melphalan.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates isolated hepatic perfusion (IHP) with melphalan in patients with isolated liver metastases from various primary tumors.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was tumor response according to RECIST criteria, measured over a median follow-up of 74 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation and blinding were not applicable as this was a single-arm study.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Median disease-free survival was 6.6 months, and median overall survival was 10.0 months.

Harms.evidence: reversible grade 3 or 4 hepatotoxicity occurred in 56%, and veno-occlusive disease in 22%.

Trial_Registration.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided.

Funding.evidence: No trial registration or funding information was provided.
